intro: Xeraea blanchetii, commonly known as the Sierra foothill buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Xeraea blanchetii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
